poem:
Title: Perished Purity

Two fires licked Mackintosh's dream,
A brutal ballet in blistering heat.
Stanza lost in the inferno's scream,
Art's heart erased by flame's deceit.
Glasgow's phantom in smoke and glow,
Symbol of not what is, but was -
Utopia's echo, now laid low.
Oblivion, meet your righteous cause.
Through charred frames, hopes lie tattered,
A vision smothered in ash and battered.
